alert.note: Alert for Caroline (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 11:16PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Delaware...and northeast Maryland... including the following counties...in central Delaware...Kent. In northeast Maryland...Caroline. * WHEN...Until 415 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1113 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain with 2 to 3 inches of rain having already fallen. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Another 1 to 2 inches of rain is possible before the rain tapers off later tonight. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Dover, Denton, Harrington, Camden, Greensboro, Oakland, Ridgely, Cheswold, Bowers, Goldsboro, Woodside, and Viola. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
